prompt:
PATIENT: 65/F
INDICATION: surveillance of airway stents
PROCEDURE: Airway clearance, Stent check, BAL (LUL), Biopsy (Left Lower Lobe), Dilation (RB2 orifice)
PLAN: Follow up 8 weeks.
completion:
NOTE_ID:  note_071 SOURCE_FILE: note_071.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: Thursday, January 15, 2026 INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 65 year-old female who presents with surveillance of airway stents.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J39.8 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J39.8 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

31645 Therapeutic aspiration initial episode 

31624 Dx bronchoscope/lavage (BAL) 

31625 Endobronchial Biopsy(s) 

31630 Balloon dilation 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENT Disposable Bronchoscope 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.

Stents are in good position. The (iCAST 7x16) was noted in the left mainstem.


Bronchoalveolar Lavage: Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at LUL.
Instilled 50 cc of NS, suction returned with 10 cc of NS. Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal).

Endobronchial Biopsy: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at Left Lower Lobe. Two areas were biopsied with NBI guidance.
Samples sent for Microbiology (Cultures/Viral/Fungal) and Pathology.

Balloon Dilation: Balloon dilation was performed at RB2 orifice.
5mm mustang balloon was used to perform dilation to 5mm at the RB2.
Total 4 inflations with dilation time of 45 seconds each.

The patient tolerated the procedure well.
There were no immediate complications. At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

EBBX 

BAL LUL 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 65 year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for airway narrowing.

f/u in clinic 

f/u in 8 weeks for bronch evaluation of stent

prompt: 81 M surveillance of airway stents. cleaned mucus from Left Lower Lobe and Right Middle Lobe. checked stents. lavaged RLL and biopsied Carina. dilated RUL bronchus 4 times.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
